data.title: Goethe-Institut Boston: Tickets, Dates & Itineraries
data.meta_description: Searching for information and tickets regarding Remembering Franz Kafka | Goethe-Institut Boston taking place in Boston on Mar 9, 2024 (UTC-5)? Trip.com has you covered. Check the dates, itineraries, and other information about Remembering Franz Kafka | Goethe-Institut Boston now! Trip.com has also prepared more similar exciting activities and discounted flight and hotel packages.
data.text:
Details

Join us at the Goethe-Institut Boston as we commemorate the 100th anniversary of Franz Kafka's death with a special event, "Remembering Franz Kafka". The event will feature a film screening and a panel discussion, giving attendees the opportunity to delve into the world of this world-famous author. The film screening will begin at 4:00 PM and will showcase "Kafka Goes to the Movies", a documentary directed by Hanns Zischler. This film explores Kafka's fascination with the emergence of cinema in the early 20th century and how it influenced his work. Experience the captivating power of early films and gain insight into Kafka's unique perspective. Following the film screening, at 5:30 PM, we will host a panel discussion titled "Franz Kafka's Diaries". This discussion will feature Ross Benjamin, the translator of Kafka's diaries, and literary scholar Veronika Tuckerov√°. Get a deeper understanding of Kafka's personal thoughts and creative process as they discuss the handwritten diaries, offering new insights and previously omitted content. "Remembering Franz Kafka" is a free event that will take place on March 9, 2024, at the Goethe-Institut Boston located at 170 Beacon Street, Boston, MA 02116. Don't miss this opportunity to delve into the mind of one of the most influential authors of the 20th century. Join us as we pay tribute to Franz Kafka's literary legacy.
